channel.title: Some Problems
channel.description: 1.None Of My Npcs Seem To Move (yes i have got an area for them to roam in but how do you make them MOVE) 2.respawn points ??? 3.an easy way to edit code (on this cpu i only have word pad etc lol)? 4.how to score points by killing certain things? 5.how to make people mods/admins? 6.how do you forward ports and wat sort of specs would be good for a server??

item.title: Some Problems
item.dc:creator: @double_helix double helix
item.description:
@double_helix wrote:

you can run it on 1gig without much trouble actually :s dont worry about it unless you start with many people.

“and a new question how do u npcs repeat things eg weapons here or join up or so and so has log on etc??”
I dont know what you are talking about

  1. The player data - there should be some files created for every player (in ./characters/ ?) that contains the playerrights - 0 normal 1 pmod 2 admin 3 owner (something like that)

Read full topic

item.title: Some Problems
item.dc:creator: @tythus tythus
item.description:
@tythus wrote:

double helix:

5. edit it in their files or make a command for it

What part of thier file ??? a small screenie would be helpful XD

double helix:

6. o.0 what are you doing here? As long as you have a nice connection, the ability to put up java and some knowledge about networks all will be fine. With 10 ppl it wouldnt lag too much on a bad server.

would 6 gigs of ram be enough lol how much u think tht would hold?? and god knows what connection speed (my internet is from a school server but more better u can do wat yer like XD)

double helix:

1. perhaps the coords are wrong - there is a good guide somewhere

im pretty sure i put coords on and make sure the monster was in the box and with dragons etc wat type of walk do i put ?

and a new question how do u npcs repeat things eg weapons here or join up or so and so has log on etc??

Read full topic

item.title: Some Problems
item.dc:creator: @double_helix double helix
item.description:
@double_helix wrote:

  1. perhaps the coords are wrong - there is a good guide somewhere
  2. look in the code
  3. Eclipse
  4. edit it in the killing method
  5. edit it in their files or make a command for it
  6. o.0 what are you doing here? As long as you have a nice connection, the ability to put up java and some knowledge about networks all will be fine. With 10 ppl it wouldnt lag too much on a bad server.

Read full topic
